headline: Applied Materials Offers Modest Sales Outlook on Slowdown of Chinese Market; Shares Fall
summary: Applied Materials forecasts revenue growth of between 8% and 12% across its core semiconductor-systems business and its applied global-services segment, respectively, but also a 28% drop in display revenue due to sales headwinds in China.

raw.headline: Applied Materials Offers Modest Sales Outlook on Slowdown of Chinese Market; Shares Fall

headline: Applied Materials stock slips on outlook
summary: Applied Materials (AMAT) reported fourth quarter adjusted earnings of $2.32 per share, topping Street estimates of $2.19. Net sales of $7.05 billion was just above the Bloomberg consensus estimate of $6.97 billion.  The stock traded lower in after-hours trading due to the outlook. The semiconductor company sees first quarter net sales of $6.75 billion to $7.55 billion, putting the midpoint of the range at $7.15 billion. Analysts had been expecting $7.25 billion.  Market Domination Overtime Anchors Julie Hyman and Josh Lipton discuss the results in the video above. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime here. This post was written by Stephanie Mikulich.

headline: Applied Materials Earnings Beat Expectations. Why the Stock Is Down.
summary: Applied Materials  gave a slightly disappointing outlook, driving its shares lower in after-hours trading Thursday.  The chip equipment maker reported adjusted earnings of $2.32 a share for the October quarter, compared with the consensus estimate of $2.19 a share among Wall Street analysts tracked by FactSet.  Applied Materials, however, provided a mixed outlook.

Applied Materials, however, provided a mixed outlook.

headline: Applied Materials: Fiscal Q4 Earnings Snapshot
summary: AMAT) on Thursday reported fiscal fourth-quarter net income of $1.73 billion. On a per-share basis, the Santa Clara, California-based company said it had net income of $2.09. Earnings, adjusted for one-time gains and costs, came to $2.32 per share.

headline: Applied Materials (NASDAQ:AMAT) Posts Better-Than-Expected Sales In Q3 But Quarterly Revenue Guidance Slightly Misses Expectations
summary: Semiconductor machinery manufacturer Applied Materials (NASDAQ:AMAT) reported Q3 CY2024 results beating Wall Street’s revenue expectations, with sales up 4.8% year on year to $7.05 billion. On the other hand, next quarter’s revenue guidance of $7.15 billion was less impressive, coming in 1.3% below analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $2.32 per share was 5.7% above analysts’ consensus estimates.
